main event: A circular, lens-shaped, bright yellow object with a flat bottom, 35-40 feet in diameter, was observed in daylight with a bright trail and no sound 5 miles southeast of Manila, Philippines on November 6, 1954.
interesting points: The object was observed at an altitude of approximately 15,000 feet and was moving in a northeasterly direction at a speed estimated to be between 300 and 500 knots.
The object varied in size and appeared to expand and contract, changing color from white to orange and back to white during the observation.
The sighting lasted approximately 5 to 7 minutes before the object disappeared from sight.
The report is heavily redacted, with many blank spaces where information has been removed, hinting at potential secrecy or sensitive information.
Multiple military personnel, including an officer and an enlisted man, were witnesses to the sighting, adding credibility to the report.
sighted object: bright yellow circular, lens-shaped object with a flat bottom
